alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued April 11 at 9:35AM MDT until April 12 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Strong southwest winds during the late morning, shifting to the northwest during the afternoon. Potential for sustained winds around 35 to 50 mph and gusts up to 60 mph. * WHERE...Entire Tri-State Area. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions associated with strong winds and (potentially) blowing dust are anticipated to be the primary impact, especially along the Interstate 70 corridor in eastern Colorado and northwest Kansas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A fair amount of uncertainty persists with regard to maximum wind gusts and the precise timing of the wind shift Tuesday afternoon.
info.instruction: Secure loose outdoor items and stay tuned for later forecasts and possible warnings.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
